data.title: Former Clark County Commissioner, Assemblywoman Myrna Williams dies
meta_keywords: State Government In The United States
data.meta_description: Myrna Williams, who served as a longtime Nevada Assemblywoman and Clark County Commissioner, has died. She was 92. The county said Williams served on the board for 12 years, from 1994 to 2006, representing the east Las Vegas valley. Caption: KSNV. She served in the Assembly prior to that for 10 years, including six as the Speaker pro Tempore, from 1984 to 1993. "It's a sad day for Clark County and the state of Nevada," Clark County Commission Chairwoman Marilyn Kirkpatrick said in a statement.
data.text:
Myrna Williams, who served as a longtime Nevada Assemblywoman and Clark County Commissioner, has died. She was 92.

The county said Williams served on the board for 12 years, from 1994 to 2006, representing the east Las Vegas valley.

She served in the Assembly prior to that for 10 years, including six as the Speaker pro Tempore, from 1984 to 1993.

"It's a sad day for Clark County and the state of Nevada," Clark County Commission Chairwoman Marilyn Kirkpatrick said in a statement. "Myrna Torme Williams was a dedicated public servant known for her intelligence, care and concern for working families and her love and passion for Las Vegas."

Williams was also the sister of renowned singer Mel Torm√©, who died in 1999.

A county spokeswoman says a memorial service for Williams is scheduled for 11 a.m. Wednesday, Jan. 5, at King David Memorial Chapel.
